sen.j: 忍器（にんき）は、かつて忍者達が使用していたであろうと考えられている道具の総称。
sen.e: Ninki is a generic name of tools that Ninja (a secret agent in feudal Japan highly skilled in stealth and secrecy) supposedly used to use.
Ninki is a general term for tools that were supposedly used by the Ninja (a secret agent in feudal Japan highly skilled in stealth and secrecy).
sen.cmt: より自然な表現となるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: Ninki is a general term for tools that were supposedly used by the Ninja (a secret agent in feudal Japan highly skilled in stealth and secrecy).

sen.j: 使用したと思われる忍器は多岐にわたる。
sen.e: Used Ninki ranged widely.
There are a wide range of Ninki that were considered to have been used.
sen.cmt: used ninkiですと、中古のような解釈も可能ですので、より原文に近い意味となるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: There are a wide range of Ninki that were considered to have been used.

sen.j: 主に、下記のように内容は細かに分類される。
sen.e: Ninki is mainly classified as follows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: They are, for the most part, classified as the following.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現となるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: They are, for the most part, classified as the following.

sen.j: 狼火（のろし）など火薬を用いる「火器」。
sen.e: "Kaki" (firearms) that used gunpowder such as Noroshi (signal fire).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Kaki" (firearms) that used gunpowder such as Noroshi (signal fire).
"Kaki" (firearms) that used gunpowder such as Noroshi (signal fire).

sen.j: 実際は定かではないが水の上を渡る際に用いたと思われる、水蜘蛛（みずぐも）などの水に関連する「水器」。
sen.e: "Suiki" that was related to water such as Mizugumo, which is not exactly known but thought be used when a Ninja got over water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Suiki" such as Mizugumo that was related to water, of which their practicality is uncertain, but are thought to be used when a Ninja got over water.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現となるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: "Suiki" such as Mizugumo that was related to water, of which their practicality is uncertain, but are thought to be used when a Ninja got over water.

sen.j: 紐の先に鉤針を付けるなどして、建造物や山を登る際に使用される、鉤梯（かぎばしご）などのものを登るための道具「登器」。
sen.e: "登器," tools that were used to climb such as Kagibashigo, which was a hook attached to a rope and used when climbing buildings and mountains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処登器の読みが不明です。
sen.e: "登器," tools that were used to climb such as Kagibashigo, which was a hook attached to a rope and used when climbing buildings and mountains.
"登器," tools that were used to climb such as Kagibashigo, which was a hook attached to a rope and used when climbing buildings and mountains.

sen.j: 敵から逃げる際、引き戸にひっかけて動かなくし、逃げる時間を稼ごうと考えられたという戸閉（とじめ）などの「開器」
sen.e: "開器" such as Tojime that were used when escaped from an enemy, hitching to a sliding door to lock and gain time for escape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処開器の読みが不明です。
sen.e: "開器" such as Tojime that were used when escaping from an enemy, hitching to a sliding door to lock and gain time for an escape.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現となるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: "開器" such as Tojime that were used when escaping from an enemy, hitching to a sliding door to lock and gain time for an escape.

sen.j: そして敵への攻撃に使用する手裏剣などの「武器」。
sen.e: "Buki" that were used to attack an enemy such as Shuriken.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 古くは藤林左武次保武が書いた忍術兵法書「万川集海」の中でも言及されている。
sen.e: The ancient Ninki was mentioned in "Bansen/Mansen Shukai," a Ninjutsu (ninja techniques) strategy book, written by Yasutake SAMUJI.
sen.cmt: 藤林左武次保武の読みが不明ですが、http://asahi.co.jp/rekishi/04-05-29/01.htmで、伊賀の郷士・藤林左武次保武（さむじやすたけ）とありましたので、参考にしました
sen.e: Ninki was mentioned as old as in "Bansen/Mansen Shukai," a Ninjutsu (ninja techniques) strategy book which was written by Yasutake SAMUJI.
sen.cmt: 「古くは」がancient ninki（昔の忍器？」となっておりますが、「昔」といった時間的な意味だと思います。
sen.e: Ninki was mentioned as old as in "Bansen/Mansen Shukai," a Ninjutsu (ninja techniques) strategy book which was written by Yasutake SAMUJI.
